lst.name: sentence
lst.str: At the last minute, a reporter asked whether Vice President George Bush had opposed the arms sales as Secretary of State George Shultz and Defense Secretary Caspar Weinberger had done.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "No, that is not true," he said before a televised news conference when asked about reports that he had been told about the money diversion by his former National Security Adviser, John Poindexter.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Reagan was giving his first formal White House press conference in four months since the Iran arms affair burst into scandal with the disclosure profits from weapons sales had been diverted, possibly illegally, to the contras.
